Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 0.55 nm, 0.86 nm (window sizes), 2.5 nm, 2.9 nm (mesoporous cages)

Other Information.Additional Info: Diclofenac selectively passes through hexagonal pores (8.6 Å x 8.6 Å) but is hindered by pentagonal pores (4.8 Å x 5.8 Å). Encapsulation occurs due to size exclusion and chemical anchoring.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with chemical interactions (π-π stacking, hydrogen bonding, coordination)

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Diclofenac adsorption capacity: 376.58 mg/g; Removal efficiency: 94.15%

Other Information.Additional Info: MIL-100-Fe was incorporated into TEMPO-oxidized cellulose nanofiber (TCNF) sponges to enhance adsorption performance and stability.

Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: Micropores (< 2 nm), Mesopores (2-50 nm), Macropores (> 50 nm)

Other Information.Additional Info: Encapsulation occurs via 'Piggybank Encapsulation' mechanism within MIL-100-Fe cages. Enhanced stability provided by TCNF labyrinth regime.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with additional stabilization mechanisms (e.g., Labyrinth Regime)

Experimental Validation.Method: Adsorption experiments, desorption tests, FTIR, XPS analysis
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Diclofenac adsorption capacity: 376.58 mg/g; Removal efficiency: 94.15%; Desorption rate after encapsulation: ~62.66%

Other Information.Additional Info: Composite material combines MIL-100-Fe with TEMPO-oxidized cellulose nanofibers (TCNF) to form a sponge-like structure with enhanced mechanical strength, biodegradability, and adsorption performance.
